results.title: Full Frontal with Samantha Bee
results.brief_description: Samantha Bee breaks up late-night’s all-male sausage fest with her nuanced view of political and cultural issues, her sharp interview skills, her repartee with world leaders and, of course, her 10-pound lady balls.

constellations_other.name: Fight for your right
constellations_other.description: Real world revolution and the fictional representations that reflect the struggle for equality in the past, present and dystopian future.

results.title: Full Frontal
results.brief_description: Full Frontal was an Australian sketch comedy series which debuted in 1993. The show first aired on the Seven Network on 13 May 1993, and finished on 18 September 1997.

constellations_other.name: Eric Bana
constellations_other.description: There must be something that draws Australian creatives like Eric Bana to darker material as they shoot to stardom overseas. Australia's penal colony past perhaps?

constellations_other.name: Nightly news and laughs
constellations_other.description: Throughout the decades on Australian screens, comedy and news have often gone hand-in-hand.

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1990s
constellations_other.description: In the 1990s, Australians and Australian culture was changing: so too were the representations of it on television.

results.description:
Full Frontal was an Australian sketch comedy series which debuted in 1993. The show first aired on the Seven Network on 13 May 1993, and finished on 18 September 1997.

In 1998 a spin-off of the show moved to Network Ten under the name Totally Full Frontal, losing most of the original cast in the process and finished in 1999.

Since 2008, re-runs have begun screening on The Comedy Channel as part of the channel’s “Aussie Gold” block of locally made, classic comedy programming.
description_for_label:
Full Frontal was an Australian sketch comedy series which debuted in 1993. The show first aired on the Seven Network on 13 May 1993, and finished on 18 September 1997.

In 1998 a spin-off of the show moved to Network Ten under the name Totally Full Frontal, losing most of the original cast in the process and finished in 1999.

Since 2008, re-runs have begun screening on The Comedy Channel as part of the channel’s “Aussie Gold” block of locally made, classic comedy programming.

results.title: Full fathom five
results.brief_description: A study of marine life, taken from the best footage of four outstanding underwater photographers. There is no narrative, instead the film is accompanied by electronic rock music.

results.title: Full cycle
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Review: 27th year”.
With the present shortage of fuel in Britain, the bicycle has come into its own as a humane machine, efficient, and adaptable alike for work or pleasure. This general film on cycling shows the manufacture of bicycles, bicycle competitions, riding and safety.

results.title: Full circle: the work of Doris Chase
results.creator_credit: Doris Chase, Elizabeth Wood and Perspective Films
results.brief_description: Documentary on painter, sculptor and filmmaker, Doris Chase. Ms Chase explains her work including the development of her sculptural furnishings for modern dance groups into video film works.

results.title: Full Circle (Oil)
results.creator_credit: Peter Sachs and W.M. Larkins Studio
results.brief_description: Shows the improved services and other benefits that oil brings to the backward territories. The financial and technical resources of foreign lands have tapped the liquid wealth hidden below the surface of the earth. In return a new prosperity and improved standard of living is being brought to the peoples of those formerly barren lands.

results.title: Full circle
results.creator_credit: Donna Read and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Women and spirituality”.
This is a stirring documentary that awakens memories of ancestral roots that connect us to each other and to all living things. It is a journey that looks at some of the manifestations of the modern women’s spirituality movement in the western world. Through contmporary spirituality, whether from Wicca, pagan or indigenous peoples we see people communing with each other or alone. Rituals become gateways that lead to an inner place where twentieth century notions of domination over the earth are replaced with a sense of awe.

results.title: Full circle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Merry Go-Round, Sex Education. - Part 3.”.
A film for eight to ten year old children which answers the question “How does the baby begin?”. An explanation of intercourse and fertilization is given, the former using drawn silhouette figures of a man and a woman, the latter through animated drawings of sperm fertilizing the egg. The second half of the programme is about parental care.

results.title: Full alert
results.creator_credit: Ringo Lam, Li Kuo-Hsing, Brilliant Idea Group and Young Filmmakers
results.brief_description: After the failure of his first Hollywood film, ‘Maximum Risk’, Lam returned to Hong Kong to shoot this $13 million action film. A claustrophobic police thriller set just after the handover of Hong Kong to China, ‘Full Alert’ revives the ‘film bleu’ tradition of Hong Kong cop and gangster films, its belligerent energy recalling the sense of anarchy in Hong Kong films of the eighties. Inspector Pao is a grizzled, jaded veteran cop who has seen it all in his years with the Hong Kong police. After a vicious murderer escapes to Taiwan, Pau vows to track him down. To him he represents a new kind of criminal— smart, canny, ambitious and vicious— a man who will stop at nothing to get what he wants. As in Michael Mann’s ‘Heat’ (1996) to which ‘Full Alert’ has been compared, the cop and the robber are set up as a pair of compelling twins/opposites driven to battle each other. They increasingly come to resemble each other in motive and character as the film progresses. Cast includes Lau Ching-Wan and Francis Ng. In Cantonese with English and Mandarin subtitles.

results.title: Full ahead Rhine
results.brief_description: Follows the journey of three of the thousands of barges which ply regularly up and down the Rhine and its tributaries. Describes some of the main towns, Dusseldorf, Cologne, Stuttgart Ludwighaven, and the industries of the areas surrounding the waterways, including coal mining, iron, steel, chemical, and primary industries.
